trans-unit.source: Represents a control that allows a user to select items from among its child elements.
<xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector> is an <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl>, which means it can contain a collection of objects of any type (such as string, image, or panel).
For more information, see the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector"></xref> class.
Adds a handler for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector.Selected"></xref> attached event.
Element that listens to this event.
Event handler to add.
Adds a handler for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector.Unselected"></xref> attached event.
Element that listens to this event.
Event handler to add.
Returns an item container to the state it was in before <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.PrepareContainerForItemOverride(System.Windows.DependencyObject,System.Object)"></xref>.

<xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector.ClearContainerForItemOverride%2A> clears the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector.IsSelected%2A?displayProperty=fullName> attached property when the item container is removed from the visual tree.
This is done so item containers behave correctly when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector> uses container recycling.

For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizationMode> and "Container Recycling" in [Optimizing Performance: Controls](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/optimizing-performance-controls.md).
The item container element.
The data item.
Gets the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector.IsSelected"></xref> attached property that indicates whether an item is selected.
Object to query concerning the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector.IsSelected"></xref> property.
Boolean value, **true** if the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector.IsSelected"></xref> property is **true**.
Gets a value that indicates whether the keyboard focus is within the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector"></xref>
The element from which to read the attached property.
Value of the property, **true** if the keyboard focus is within the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector.IsSelected"></xref> attached property.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector.IsSelectionActive"></xref> attached property.

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector"></xref> should keep the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector.SelectedItem"></xref> synchronized with the current item in the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items"></xref> property.

You can set the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector.IsSynchronizedWithCurrentItem%2A> property to `true` to ensure that the item selected always corresponds to the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemCollection.CurrentItem%2A> property in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemCollection>.
For example, suppose that there are two <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ListBox> controls with their <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.ItemsSource%2A> property set to the same source.

Set <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector.IsSynchronizedWithCurrentItem%2A> to `true` on both list boxes to ensure that the selected item in each <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ListBox> is the same.
XAML Attribute Usage
<*object* `IsSynchronizedWithCurrentItem`="<xref:System.Boolean>"/>
\- or -
<*object* `IsSynchronizedWithCurrentItem`="{}"/>
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None

`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector.SelectedItem"></xref> is always synchronized with the current item in the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemCollection"></xref>; `false` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector.SelectedItem"></xref> is never synchronized with the current item; `null` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector.SelectedItem"></xref> is synchronized with the current item only if the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector"></xref> uses a <xref href="System.Windows.Data.CollectionView"></xref>.
The default value is `null`.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector.IsSynchronizedWithCurrentItem"></xref> dependency property.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Initialized"></xref> event.
This method is invoked whenever <xref href="System.Windows.FrameworkElement.IsInitialized"></xref> is set to `true` internally.
The <xref href="System.Windows.RoutedEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Called when the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement.IsKeyboardFocusWithin"></xref> property has changed.
The event data.
Updates the current selection when an item in the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector"></xref> has changed
The event data.
Called when the source of an item in a selector changes.
Old value of the source.
New value of the source.
Called when the selection changes.
The event data.
Prepares the specified element to display the specified item.
The element that is used to display the specified item.
The specified item to display.
Removes a handler for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector.Selected"></xref> attached event.
Element that listens to this event.
Event handler to remove.
Removes a handler for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector.Unselected"></xref> attached event.
Element that listens to this event.
Event handler to remove.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector.Selected"></xref> routed event.
Gets or sets the index of the first item in the current selection or returns negative one (-1) if the selection is empty.

If a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector> supports selecting a single item, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector.SelectedIndex%2A> property returns the index of the selected item.

If a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector> supports multiple selections, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector.SelectedIndex%2A> returns the index of the item that the user selected first.

Setting <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector.SelectedIndex%2A> in a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector> that supports multiple selections clears existing selected items and sets the selection to the item specified by the index.
<xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector.SelectedIndex%2A> returns -1 if selection is empty.
If you set <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector.SelectedIndex%2A> to a value less that -1, an <xref:System.ArgumentException> is thrown.
If you set <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector.SelectedIndex%2A> to a value equal or greater than the number of child elements, the value is ignored.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
<xref:System.Windows.FrameworkPropertyMetadata.BindsTwoWayByDefault%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkPropertyMetadata.Journal%2A>
The index of first item in the current selection.
The default value is negative one (-1).
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector.SelectedIndex"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets the first item in the current selection or returns null if the selection is empty
If a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector> supports selecting a single item, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector.SelectedItem%2A> property returns the selected item.
If a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector> supports multiple selections, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector.SelectedItem%2A> returns the item that the user selected first.

Setting <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector.SelectedItem%2A> in a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector> that supports multiple selections clears existing selected items and sets the selection to the item specified.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
<xref:System.Windows.FrameworkPropertyMetadata.BindsTwoWayByDefault%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkPropertyMetadata.Journal%2A>
The first item in the current selection or `null` if the selection is empty.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector.SelectedItem"></xref> dependency property.

Gets or sets the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector.SelectedItem"></xref>, obtained by using <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector.SelectedValuePath"></xref>.

The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector.SelectedValuePath%2A> property specifies the path to the property that is used to determine the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector.SelectedValue%2A> property.
Setting <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector.SelectedValue%2A> to a value X attempts to select an item whose value evaluates to X; if no such item can be found, the selection is cleared.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
<xref:System.Windows.FrameworkPropertyMetadata.BindsTwoWayByDefault%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkPropertyMetadata.Journal%2A>
The value of the selected item.

Gets or sets the path that is used to get the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector.SelectedValue"></xref> from the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector.SelectedItem"></xref>.

The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector.SelectedValuePath%2A> property specifies the path to the property that is used to determine the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector.SelectedValue%2A> property.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
The path used to get the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector.SelectedValue"></xref>.
The default is an empty string.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector.SelectedValuePath"></xref> dependency property.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector.SelectedValue"></xref> dependency property.
Occurs when the selection of a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector"></xref> changes.
This event occurs whenever there is a change to a selection.
A selection can be changed not only by user interaction but also by binding as well as other set values.
Routed Event Information
Identifier field
Routing strategy
Bubbling
Delegate
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector.SelectionChanged"></xref> routed event.
Sets a property value that indicates whether an item in a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector"></xref> is selected.
Object on which to set the property.
Value to set.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector.Unselected"></xref> routed event.
